oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Order from General Bragg, issued by Assistant Adjutant General George G. Garner, congratulating the army on its role in the Confederate victory at the Battle of Hartsville and also permitting the corps engaged in that action to bear the name of the battle upon each of their colors.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Adjutant and Inspector-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: General orders are published directives issued by a commander, binding upon all personnel under his command, to affect policies or procedures unique to a unit's situation not addressed by service regulations. General orders have the force of law within a unit. This order was issued as a congratulatory report of the victory at Hartsville, but an official change in the color standards of a unit also requires the issuance of an order.
